source.title: Frontosubthalamic Circuits for Control of Action and Cognition

confidence_rationale: Strong synthesis evidence for fast inhibitory control circuits consistent with restraint-oriented vigilance mode assumptions.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Frontal-subthalamic pathways provide rapid control over action and cognitive suppression.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-026 by grounding ready-vigilance as primed monitoring with active motor suppression channels.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Review-level synthesis does not by itself specify full state-transition dynamics or mode persistence thresholds.
mapping.source_context: Circuit-level review covering inhibitory control across action and cognition.
